content: Room quota has been successfully disabled.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a success message when room quota has been successfully disabled. It is likely used in an UI element such as a button or dialog that triggers this functionality. The text appears after attempting to disable room quota, and its translation will be shown depending on the current room quota status.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Otaq kvotası uğurla deaktiv edildi" sounds slightly awkward in Azerbaijani. A more natural phrasing would be "Otaq kvotası məcbusi ilə dayandırıldı" or "Otaq kvotası ləğv edildi".
While technically correct, 'Kvóty místností byly úspěšně zakázány' is a bit stiff and literal. A more natural and user-friendly translation might be preferable.

The Lao translation "ກວດກາຈຳນວນຫ້ອງຖືກປິດການໃຊ້ງານຢ່າງຖືກຕ້ອງແລ້ວ" literally translates to "Room number check has been correctly disabled." This doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Room quota has been successfully disabled.' The word 'ກວດກາ' (check/inspect) is misplaced and creates a confusing meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ປິດການໃຊ້ງານຈຳນວນຫ້ອງຢ່າງຖືກຕ້ອງແລ້ວ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically understandable, the flow of the suggested correction 'ປິດການໃຊ້ງານຈຳນວນຫ້ອງຢ່າງຖືກຕ້ອງແລ້ວ' could be improved for naturalness.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຈຳນວນຫ້ອງຖືກປິດການໃຊ້ງານຢ່າງຖືກຕ້ອງແລ້ວ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Limit pokoi został wyłączony' is understandable, a more accurate and natural translation of 'Room quota has been successfully disabled' would be 'Ograniczenie liczby pokoi zostało wyłączone.' 'Limit' is often used for financial limits, not room quotas.

The translation 'Cotă de stocare pentru sală a fost dezactivată cu succes' is a bit literal and clunky. 'Sală' translates to 'room,' but in this context, it's referring to a storage space or capacity associated with a room, not the room itself. It's not natural Romanian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Cotă de stocare a fost dezactivată cu succes.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'Cotă' can also be translated as 'Limita'. Using 'Limita' might be more commonly understood in this context, especially for a technical setting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Limita de stocare a fost dezactivată cu succes.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'කාමර ප්‍රමාණය සක්‍රීය කර නැහැ' literally translates to 'Room quantity deactivated.' While conveying a similar meaning, 'disabled' implies a different action than 'deactivated'. It's more accurate to use a term that directly reflects 'disabled' in this context.

The Serbian translation "Квота просторије је " is incomplete. It seems to be cut off and doesn't convey the full meaning of "Room quota has been successfully disabled." It's missing the words indicating success and completion.
